review_text: Cozy and calming are two words that describe Whitneyâ€™s home. From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed and settled. The apartment is darling and had ample space for my weekly work hybrid visit. The home is modern, yet retains the antique charm of its age. The bed is sumptuous, and I immediately fell asleep with the fuzzy quilts and feather pillows. Longview was a perfect location for my job in Oregon and offered beautiful tree lined streets, quaint shops, and yummy restaurants. Be sure to check out The Merk building, adorned with history of Longview, its wonderful shops, and Holos Yoga. Unfortunately, I did not have a chance to check out Lake Sacajawea or the wonderful restaurant recommendations from Whitney, but I know that I can save those adventures for my next trip to Longview and will definitely book this stay again!

review_text:
Whitneyâ€™s apartment was wonderful. Itâ€™s nestled in a safe neighborhood. The apartment has a relaxed homey type feel. We spent several nights there and rarely heard or saw the other tenants.
The bed was very comfortable and all the linens were clean. Extra blankets were available in the closet. We didnâ€™t need them. One thing worth mentioning, is the bed was a tight fit in the small room. There is only about 1 ft clearance at the end of the bed. It wasnâ€™t a big issue for us, but it could possibly be for some people. There is plenty of room on both sides of the bed.
We cooked frequently in the kitchen. All the appliances were in good working condition. Some of the basics were available: sugar, oil, some spices, coffee.
I loved the essential oils that were available to use with a defuser. It was a nice touch.
The TV has Netflix and cable, although we never used it. The internet worked very well.
We would definitely stay again. We felt right at home.

review_text: Whitney is probably the most thoughtful AirBnB host I've ever encountered! She is an excellent communicator and an amazing host! She also recommended some gorgeous hikes near Mt St Helens and provided us with recommendations for all the cool spots in Longview. The place itself was very welcoming, sparkling clean, and had everything we needed to enjoy our stay. It is very stylish and has a beautiful garden in the back. Plus, the condo is conveniently located and is in a very quiet neighborhood. Whitney made our trip to Mt St Helens extra special. We can't recommend her place enough!

review_text: Whitney is a natural and attentive host. For everything we needed, she was always there, and always went the extra mile. The house is a cozy, charming spot nestled in a park-like neighborhood. Little details like an old-fashioned record player made it feel like home. (Whitney personally shared some of her records for us to enjoy.) We stayed long term, for several months, and loved it. The neighbors are kind and fun to be around, and there is a garden in the back that is very peaceful. The house has a very compact, functional layout, full of natural light, with a spacious living room, single bedroom and small kitchen. The kitchen has everything you need to effectively feed two people, but does lack elbow room. We adapted the living room into an office area and it worked phenomenally well.

The crockpot was a win and made big meals like spaghetti and tacos for an army easy to clean up after. We appreciated the home having supplies to accommodate us.
We all loved the area - a tip is that many carriers lose service at the bottom of rose hill drive. Youâ€™ll get it again at the house.

review_text: This was the best air bnb that we have stayed in so far. We arrived on the 4th of July, and Luke was very helpful in supplying information about what fireworks he would accept before I had to ask. We found the place was peaceful and very private, as described, with the bonus of quaint local wildlife that would scamper and play in the garden. We appreciated the wood for the firepit and the tiki torch fuel that repelled mosquitos. The bed was comfortable, and there were plenty of extra blankets and pillows if needed. The kitchen was stocked with the essentials and a bit more. The TV had a good amount of channels for kids and adults, and there was easy access to wifi. Luke was very helpful and communicative, providing good directions to the house, check in and check out info, and offering to answer questions. He was a super host for sure. We would definitely consider staying here again.

It's just a special and quiet location, I recommend it to anyone wanting to have privacy and to be in peace.

review_text: Had a lovely 4-night stay here. The house is very private and peaceful, sitting off the road surrounded by trees. We saw deer in the yard several times! The house was very clean, and the host was great at communicating. The hot tub is an inflatable hot tub that takes some time to warm up, but it was a nice bonus to be able to enjoy it on a chilly evening. Convenient to shopping and restaurants in Kelso/Longview, and only about 45 minutes to Portland. It was a great home base to explore Washington and Oregon for a few days with friends. There aren't many airbnb options in this area, and this is one I'd highly recommend.

This is the most charming, adorable lake house in the perfect location! Beautiful views of the lake while sitting in the living room. The entire house was very clean and had all the household amenities you could need. The kitchen had every pot/pan/utensil you would need, and seasonings too. Loved that every room had extra pillows and blankets in the closets. The dining room had a huge table with plenty of space for the whole family and more. The living room was furnished with the best, comfy oversized sofas, which was perfect for watching a movie on a cold, rainy night in November. We also loved the welcome basket with goodies and chocolates on the beds. Definitely the only place we will stay when we go to Longview!
The only thing I would change is to update the bathroom. It was perfectly fine for me, but I was traveling with my elder father and it seemed like the shower tub wall was higher than standard and was a little difficult for a person with some mobility issues to use. Again, this wouldnâ€™t be an issue for most people, but just something to be aware of.

Very comfortable, great amenities and attention to detail. I will be returning.

review_text: We were a family of two grandparents, two parents and 4 kids. This home was perfect for us and I hope to stay there again some day. It had everything we needed and everything was top quality - furniture, beds, linens, towels, dishes, appliances, cookware, televisions, washer/dryer, etc. We were welcomed with sparkling cider and popcorn (although it wasn't used) and the master bath had a tray of toothpaste, toothbrushes, dental floss, razors, things a person might forget to pack. We were not in the house for a good part of each day, but when we were, the kids (and adults) had a great time playing pool, ping pong, or air hockey on the three-way table, and the games on the walls were a hit. Hot tub was only used once, but it was clean and enjoyable. Playscape was only used one evening but the kids loved it. Basketball game in the garage was also a hit. Only problem was with a shower fixture on our last evening, but we made do. I very highly recommend this home to any family.

review_text: Overall, we had an okay experience here. The location is beautiful and walkable. There were some issues with the cleanliness of the apartment when we arrived. We notified Kathleen and she did everything in her power at that point to fix the issue, including sending a housekeeper the next day and offering us a partial refund. Kathleen was very responsive through AirBNB messaging and via phone call. We had some issues with the lock box when coming and going, nothing major but it does require a little extra time and maneuvering. The apartment itself looks like the photos and is well stocked. The washer and dryer are inside of the main house, which is currently being rented by four tenants. I only mention this because I didn't know that when booking, though Kathleen did notify us in a message prior to arrival. I only saw the tenants in passing and they seemed friendly. Also, if you are hot natured be aware that there is no AC in the fall-winter but there is a screened window you can open.

review_text: Enjoyed a lovely stay at Kathleen's studio. The apartment was clean, comfortable, and located in a serene neighborhood. I enjoyed walking over to the nearby park and watching the ospreys drive into the water--so cool! The kitchen was well-stocked and had all the equipment needed to prepare meals. I stayed at Kathleen's as my "base camp" as I explored Mount Saint Helens and the Ridgefield National Wildlife Refuge. It was great being able to come back after hikes and birding to such a relaxing and quiet space. Highly recommend staying at the studio if you are exploring the area or in need of a quiet escape. Kathleen is an excellent host and checking in/out was incredibly easy and convenient.

review_text:
Pros: Great location with lovely park across the street.
Very clean and well appointed.
Well-stocked kitchen with various food items - really nice touch.
Easy check-in & check-out, great communication, off-street parking.
Cons: Only one "lounging chair" (two small wood chairs with table, bed)
Air conditioner is loud.
Windows small (not a ton of natural light) & no screens for opening windows.
Unfortunately, we did not get a good night's sleep in spite of the comfortable bed. While it was not super hot outside while we were there, the apartment was quite warm. We turned on the air conditioner (not central air) and used the very small portable fan. The air conditioner was quite loud and the level of loudness fluctuated throughout the night, which would frequently awaken us. If this issue had not been present, we would have given 5 stars.

I travel to Rainier for work once a month and the location and amenities are perfect. Quiet, cozy, and everything you need in an Airbnb. I love feeding the goats and pig and lying in the hammock is divine. If you have time, have Kristin tell you the story of the Tiny House Hillside Hideaway, itâ€™s truly a treat! My goal is to have my own tiny house one day and this is a perfect opportunity to try it out. Also, I cannot wait to return this summer when the family tiny house will be complete so I can share this gem with my family. I have stayed in the winter and spring and they are equally tranquil. The sunrises and views are amazing and it makes you want to jump out of bed to greet the day. The drive up the hill on the winding road feels like you are entering a rainforest or something out of the Lord of the Rings with the moss covered gates.

review_text: This is the best airbnb experience I've ever had! The pictures don't do its justice: the view is spectacular, and the house is full of gadgets and accommodations just in the right place, even table games! You feel the welcoming atmosphere everywhere with these arrangements made by the host, which reminds me of the good old days of airbnb when it's not that commercialized. The caring feeling brings home-like aura and can be therapeutic for those who need a weekend retreat. Feeding the goats and pigs while having breakfast are one of a kind life experience. Llama is usually refined and elegant and tend not to fight for the treats like others do. Waking up midnight and see all the stars from the bed is super romantic. You can either enjoy the warmth and coziness inside or take a walk in the serene surroundings. I usually don't write reviews this long but I just have too many to say otherwise my soul will complain. Highly recommend!!

I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars,
Kristin and Matt made sure we were comfortable and taken care of multiple times during our stay.
The tiny house was sparkly clean and accommodating. It's a perfect spot to explore Washington and Oregon State, the location has beautiful views and it's very easy to drive around. Remembering that you are in the mountains, so to get to the house there's a gravel way, that is better if you have a bigger car, sports cars are not good with the road LOL
One thing that impressed me very much was the attention to detail, you can tell that Kristin and Matt LOVE to host, from all they make available in the kitchen, so you can cook nice homemade meals, to the variety of pillows, so you can choose one that suits you best, this experience is on TOP of my list.
My best friend and I want to make it to the tiny house, a yearly thing!
We can't thank you enough for letting us stay in your charming house and for you being so nice and sweet to us!

review_text: The two of us stayed for one lovely night in Kristen's tiny house. She was a wonderful host and thoughtfully provided us with a unique code for the door (changed after every stay) so we would remember it easily! The kitchen was stocked with essentials like oil, spices, pans, etc., which was a nice extra touch. Everything was incredibly clean and organized and we felt like we had a very secluded and private space to enjoy our night in. The next morning, we loved feeding the goats and llama while enjoying coffee provided by Kristen. For other people who are hiking in the area, it was a super easy drive to Mt St Helens. Kristen kindly provided us with some recommendations of other great hikes in the area. Cannot recommend this spot enough!

name: Craig

Rating, 5 stars

Â·

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
This place deserves more stars for so many reasons. This for me is what Air BnB is all about. Getting to experience an adventure like a tiny home on a working farm that I just don't get in my city life. Here are the reasons you need to book Kristin's place because soon this location will be sold out and the price will have to go up.
1. A tiny house experience that is not short on comfort. Full size fridge, shower and queen size bed.
2. A tranquil setting with endless views of the Columbia River. In short peace and quiet without other humans.
3. A chance to feed the goats and llama. A farm experience 20 feet away if you want it.
4. A great host in Kristin who goes above and beyond. The farm fresh eggs and welcome treats were the icing on the cake.
5. An outdoor camping experience with the tiny house comforts just 10 feet away. A canopy with chairs facing the fire pit and the river plus a hammock for an afternoon snooze after a day of hiking.

What a terrific tiny house! We've stayed in a few tiny houses and this one felt the largest by far thanks to the well-planned layout. It was nice to be able to comfortably cook dinner in the kitchen - loved the ample counter space. And the placement of the bathroom and bedroom at each end meant we weren't having to walk through one to get to the other. Everything was very clean and well maintained, including the super comfortable bed.
The outdoor spaces are so peaceful, with an amazing view and plenty of options for relaxing. We got lucky and had goats around for both dinner and breakfast.
Kristin and Matt were great hosts, providing plenty of info to help our check-in go smoothly and making sure we were comfortable and had everything we need for a great stay. We highly recommend their tiny house!
